heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A –
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – 
Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Relevant Counties) (Amendment) (No. 2) 
Regulations 2020.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 2. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid19) (Relevant Counties) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 295 of 2020) (amended by
text_raw:
2. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid19) (Relevant Counties) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 295 of 2020) (amended by 
the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) 
(Relevant Counties) (Amendment) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 297 of 2020)) 
are amended - 

(a) 

in Regulation 2(1), by the substitution of “the 7th day of 
September 2020” for “the 23rd day of August 2020”, 

(b) 

in Regulation 4(4) - 

(i) 

by the insertion of the following subparagraphs after 
subparagraph (b): 

“(ba) attend, for educational reasons, a school, university, 
higher education institution or other education and 
training facility or to accompany to such school, 
university, higher education institution or other 
education and training facility, any other person 
residing with the person, or a vulnerable person, 

(bb) access crèche or other childcare facilities,”, and 

(ii) 

in subparagraphs (c) and (e), by the substitution of 
“residing with the person,” for “residing in the relevant 
residence”, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 25th August, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [315] 3 

(c) 

in Regulation 6(3)(a), by the substitution of the following clause 
for clause (iii): 

“(iii) is a member of an inter-county team, at senior or minor 
level, in a competition organised by the organisations 
commonly known and referred to as the Gaelic Athletic 
Association, the Ladies Gaelic Football Association or the 
Camogie Association, or”, and 

(d) 

in Schedule 1, by the deletion of paragraphs 2 and 3. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 August, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [315]

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Relevant Counties) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 295 of 
2020 as amended by S.I. No. 297 of 2020) to remove restrictions under those 
Regulations in Counties Laois and Offaly and to extend the restrictions in 
County Kildare until midnight Sunday, 6 September 2020. The Regulations 
also amend Regulation 4 of S.I. No. 295 of 2020 to include travelling to attend 
school and college and for childcare purposes within the reasonable excuses for 
travelling to or from Kildare. Regulation 6 is amended to refer to the Ladies 
Gaelic Football Association and the Camogie Association. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [315] 5
